answers.answer: Robert,Many medical conditions can mimic psychiatric disorders and  are always important to rule the common problems out (ie thyroid disease, diabetes, cardiac conditions).  Some identified medical issues such as Parkinsons DZ have associated psychiatric symptoms such as depression and dementia.  The underlying condition needs to be addressed and sometimes the psychiatric manifestations will disappear but often they may persist.  In the case that the behavioral manifestations persist then psychotropics are indicated  and helpful.  You may discuss this issue further with your psychiatrist and consider discontinuation of your meds to see how you function without them.  I hope this was helpful.Sincerely,HFHS MD-JMKeywords: Medical illness, psychiatric manifestations
